4 is a hardware limitation.

initialize color renderables.

initialize the viewport rectangle.

create the depth/stencil renderables.

make sure the depth buffer has valid dimensions.

now we can create the framebuffer object.

4 is a hardware limitation.

initialize color renderables.

initialize the viewport rectangle.

create the depth/stencil renderables.

create the appropriate renderable.

check the format to see if we need to create a stencil renderable.

now we can create the framebuffer object.

void GrRenderTarget::SetActiveFace ( GrTextureCube::ECUBEFACE  face  )

Definition at line 515 of file grrendertarget.cpp.

void GrRenderTarget::SetViewportRect ( const URect &  viewportRect  ) 

sets the viewport rectangle associated with the render target.

this function cannot be used on the primary render target since the primary render target's viewport comes from the primary display surface (the window).
